00036 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00042 /* CONFIGURABLE MACROS ----------------------------------------------- */
00043 /* For the EMAC test, there are two ways to test:
00044         - TX_ONLY and BOUNCE_RX flags can be set one at a time, not both.
00045         When TX_ONLY is set to 1, it's a TX_ONLY packet from the MCB1700
00046         board to the LAN. Use the traffic analyzer such as ethereal, once
00047         the program is running, the packets can be monitored on the traffic
00048         analyzer.
00049         - When BOUNCE_RX is set to 1 (TX_ONLY needs to reset to 0), it's a
00050         test to test both TX and RX, use the traffic generator/analyzer,
00051         you can creat a packet with the destination address as that on the
00052         MCB1700 board, use the traffic generator to send packets, as long
00053         as the destination address matches, MCB1700 will reverse the source
00054         and destination address and send the packets back on the network.
00055         ENABLE_WOL flag is used to test power down and WOL functionality.
00056         BOUNCE_RX flag needs to be set to 1 when WOL is being tested.
00057 */
00058 #define TX_ONLY                         0
00059 #define BOUNCE_RX                       1
00060 #define ENABLE_WOL                      1
00061 #define ENABLE_HASH                     1
00062 
00063 
00064 #if TX_ONLY
00065 /* This is the MAC address of LPC1768 */
00066 #define EMAC_ADDR12             0x0000101F
00067 #define EMAC_ADDR34             0x0000E012
00068 #define EMAC_ADDR56             0x00001D0C
00069 /* A pseudo destination MAC address is defined for
00070  * both TX_ONLY and BOUNCE_RX test */
00071 #define EMAC_DST_ADDR12         0x0000E386
00072 #define EMAC_DST_ADDR34         0x00006BDA
00073 #define EMAC_DST_ADDR56         0x00005000
00074 #endif
00075 
00076 #if BOUNCE_RX
00077 /* This is the MAC address of LPC1768 */
00078 #define EMAC_ADDR12             0x0000E386
00079 #define EMAC_ADDR34             0x00006BDA
00080 #define EMAC_ADDR56             0x00005000
00081 /* A pseudo destination MAC address is defined for
00082  * both TX_ONLY and BOUNCE_RX test */
00083 #define EMAC_DST_ADDR12         0x0000101F
00084 #define EMAC_DST_ADDR34         0x0000E012
00085 #define EMAC_DST_ADDR56         0x00001D0C
00086 #endif
00087 
00088 /* LED definitions */
00089 #define PD_LED_PIN              (1<<6)
00090 #define TX_LED_PIN              (1<<5)
00091 #define RX_LED_PIN              (1<<4)
00092 #define KB_LED_PIN              (1<<3)
00093 #define BLINK_LED_PIN   (1<<2)
00094 #define LED2_MASK               ((1<<2) | (1<<3) | (1<<4) | (1<<5) | (1<<6))
00095 #define LED1_MASK               ((1<<28) | (1<<29) | (1<<31))

00100 #define TX_PACKET_SIZE          114
00101 
00102 #define MYMAC_1         ((EMAC_ADDR12 & 0xFF00) >> 8)
00103 #define MYMAC_2         ((EMAC_ADDR12 & 0xFF))
00104 #define MYMAC_3         ((EMAC_ADDR34 & 0xFF00) >> 8)
00105 #define MYMAC_4         ((EMAC_ADDR34 & 0xFF))
00106 #define MYMAC_5         ((EMAC_ADDR56 & 0xFF00) >> 8)
00107 #define MYMAC_6         ((EMAC_ADDR56 & 0xFF))
00108

00112 /*  PRIVATE VARIABLES ----------------------------------------------- */

00114 
00115 #ifdef __IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__
00116 /* Global Tx Buffer data */
00117 #pragma data_alignment=4
00118 uint8_t gTxBuf[TX_PACKET_SIZE + 0x10];
00119 /* Global Rx Buffer data */
00120 #pragma data_alignment=4
00121 uint8_t gRxBuf[TX_PACKET_SIZE + 0x10];
00122 #else
00123 /* Global Tx Buffer data */
00124 uint8_t __attribute__ ((aligned (4))) gTxBuf[TX_PACKET_SIZE + 0x10];
00125 /* Global Rx Buffer data */
00126 uint8_t __attribute__ ((aligned (4))) gRxBuf[TX_PACKET_SIZE + 0x10];
00127 #endif
00128 
00129 /* EMAC address */
00130 uint8_t EMACAddr[] = {MYMAC_6, MYMAC_5, MYMAC_4, MYMAC_3, MYMAC_2, MYMAC_1};

00133 __IO uint32_t RXOverrunCount = 0;
00134 __IO uint32_t RXErrorCount = 0;
00135 __IO uint32_t TXUnderrunCount = 0;
00136 __IO uint32_t TXErrorCount = 0;
00137 __IO uint32_t RxFinishedCount = 0;
00138 __IO uint32_t TxFinishedCount = 0;
00139 __IO uint32_t TxDoneCount = 0;

00171 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00172 /*********************************************************************/
00177 void ENET_IRQHandler (void)
00178 {
00179         EMAC_PACKETBUF_Type RxDatbuf;
00180         uint32_t RxLen;
00181 
00182         /* EMAC Ethernet Controller Interrupt function. */
00183         uint32_t int_stat;
00184         // Get EMAC interrupt status
00185         while ((int_stat = (LPC_EMAC->IntStatus & LPC_EMAC->IntEnable)) != 0) {
00186                 // Clear interrupt status
00187                 LPC_EMAC->IntClear = int_stat;
00188                 /* scan interrupt status source */
00189 
00190                 /* ---------- receive overrun ------------*/
00191                 if((int_stat & EMAC_INT_RX_OVERRUN))
00192                 {
00193                         RXOverrunCount++;
00194                         _DBG_("Rx overrun");
00195                 }
00196 
00197                 /*-----------  receive error -------------*/
00198                 /* Note:
00199                  * The EMAC doesn't distinguish the frame type and frame length,
00200                  * so, e.g. when the IP(0x8000) or ARP(0x0806) packets are received,
00201                  * it compares the frame type with the max length and gives the
00202                  * "Range" error. In fact, this bit is not an error indication,
00203                  * but simply a statement by the chip regarding the status of
00204                  * the received frame
00205                  */
00206                 if ((int_stat & EMAC_INT_RX_ERR))
00207                 {
00208                         if (EMAC_CheckReceiveDataStatus(EMAC_RINFO_RANGE_ERR) == RESET){
00209                                 RXErrorCount++;
00210                                 _DBG_("Rx error: ");
00211                         }
00212                 }
00213 
00214                 /* ---------- RX Finished Process Descriptors ----------*/
00215                 if ((int_stat & EMAC_INT_RX_FIN))
00216                 {
00217                         RxFinishedCount++;
00218                         _DBG_("Rx finish");
00219                 }
00220 
00221                 /* ---------- Receive Done -----------------------------*/
00222                 /* Note: All packets are greater than (TX_PACKET_SIZE + 4)
00223                  * will be ignore!
00224                  */
00225                 if ((int_stat & EMAC_INT_RX_DONE))
00226                 {
00227                         /* Packet received, check if packet is valid. */
00228                         if (EMAC_CheckReceiveIndex()){
00229                                 if (!EMAC_CheckReceiveDataStatus(EMAC_RINFO_LAST_FLAG)){
00230                                         goto rel;
00231                                 }
00232                                 // Get data size, trip out 4-bytes CRC field, note that length in (-1) style format
00233                                 RxLen = EMAC_GetReceiveDataSize() - 3;
00234                                 // Note that packet added 4-bytes CRC created by yourself
00235                                 if ((RxLen > (TX_PACKET_SIZE + 4)) || (EMAC_CheckReceiveDataStatus(EMAC_RINFO_ERR_MASK))) {
00236                                         /* Invalid frame, ignore it and free buffer */
00237                                         goto rel;
00238                                 }
00239                                 ReceiveLength = RxLen;
00240                                 // Valid Frame, just copy it
00241                                 RxDatbuf.pbDataBuf = (uint32_t *)gRxBuf;
00242                                 RxDatbuf.ulDataLen = RxLen;
00243                                 EMAC_ReadPacketBuffer(&RxDatbuf);
00244                                 PacketReceived = TRUE;
00245 
00246                 rel:
00247                                 /* Release frame from EMAC buffer */
00248                                 EMAC_UpdateRxConsumeIndex();
00249                         }
00250                         _DBG_("Rx done");
00251                         RxDoneCount++;
00252                 }
00253 
00254                 /*------------------- Transmit Underrun -----------------------*/
00255                 if ((int_stat & EMAC_INT_TX_UNDERRUN))
00256                 {
00257                         TXUnderrunCount++;
00258                         _DBG_("Tx under-run");
00259                 }
00260 
00261                 /*------------------- Transmit Error --------------------------*/
00262                 if ((int_stat & EMAC_INT_TX_ERR))
00263                 {
00264                         TXErrorCount++;
00265                         _DBG_("Tx error");
00266                 }
00267 
00268                 /* ----------------- TX Finished Process Descriptors ----------*/
00269                 if ((int_stat & EMAC_INT_TX_FIN))
00270                 {
00271                         TxFinishedCount++;
00272                         _DBG_("Tx finish");
00273                 }
00274 
00275                 /* ----------------- Transmit Done ----------------------------*/
00276                 if ((int_stat & EMAC_INT_TX_DONE))
00277                 {
00278                         TxDoneCount++;
00279                         _DBG_("Tx done");
00280                 }
00281 #if ENABLE_WOL
00282                 /* ------------------ Wakeup Event Interrupt ------------------*/
00283                 /* Never gone here since interrupt in this
00284                  * functionality has been disable, even if in wake-up mode
00285                  */
00286                 if ((int_stat & EMAC_INT_WAKEUP))
00287                 {
00288                         WOLCount++;
00289                 }
00290 #endif
00291         }
00292 }

00294 #if TX_ONLY
00295 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00296 /*********************************************************************/
00301 void EINT0_IRQHandler(void)
00302 {
00303         LPC_SC->EXTINT |= 0x1;  //clear the EINT0 flag
00304         LED_Blink(KB_LED_PIN);
00305         Pressed = SET;
00306 }
00307 #elif defined(IAR_LPC_1768)
00308 /*********************************************************************/
00313 void EINT3_IRQHandler(void)
00314 {
00315         LPC_SC->EXTINT |= (0x1<<3);  //clear the EINT0 flag
00316         LED_Blink(KB_LED_PIN);
00317         Pressed = SET;
00318 }
00319 #endif
00320 #endif
00321 
00322 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS-----------------------------------*/
00323 /*********************************************************************/
00328 void PacketGen( uint8_t *txptr )
00329 {
00330   int i;
00331   uint32_t crcValue;
00332   uint32_t BodyLength = TX_PACKET_SIZE - 14;
00333 
00334   /* Dest address */
00335   *(txptr+0) = EMAC_DST_ADDR56 & 0xFF;
00336   *(txptr+1) = (EMAC_DST_ADDR56 >> 0x08) & 0xFF;
00337   *(txptr+2) = EMAC_DST_ADDR34 & 0xFF;
00338   *(txptr+3) = (EMAC_DST_ADDR34 >> 0x08) & 0xFF;
00339   *(txptr+4) = EMAC_DST_ADDR12 & 0xFF;
00340   *(txptr+5) = (EMAC_DST_ADDR12 >> 0x08) & 0xFF;
00341 
00342   /* Src address */
00343   *(txptr+6) = EMAC_ADDR56 & 0xFF;
00344   *(txptr+7) = (EMAC_ADDR56 >> 0x08) & 0xFF;
00345   *(txptr+8) = EMAC_ADDR34 & 0xFF;
00346   *(txptr+9) = (EMAC_ADDR34 >> 0x08) & 0xFF;
00347   *(txptr+10) = EMAC_ADDR12 & 0xFF;
00348   *(txptr+11) = (EMAC_ADDR12 >> 0x08) & 0xFF;
00349 
00350   /* Type or length, body length is TX_PACKET_SIZE - 14 bytes */
00351   *(txptr+12) = BodyLength & 0xFF;
00352   *(txptr+13) = (BodyLength >> 0x08) & 0xFF;
00353 
00354   /* Skip the first 14 bytes for dst, src, and type/length */
00355   for ( i=0; i < BodyLength; i++ )
00356   {
00357         *(txptr+i+14) = 0x55;
00358   }
00359 
00360   // Calculate CRC
00361   crcValue = crc32_bfr( txptr, TX_PACKET_SIZE );
00362 
00363   // Add 4-byte CRC
00364   *(txptr+TX_PACKET_SIZE) = (0xff & crcValue);
00365   *(txptr+TX_PACKET_SIZE+1) = 0xff & (crcValue >> 8 );
00366   *(txptr+TX_PACKET_SIZE+2) = 0xff & (crcValue >> 16);
00367   *(txptr+TX_PACKET_SIZE+3) = 0xff & (crcValue >> 24);
00368 }
00369 
00370 /*********************************************************************/
00375 void LED_Init (void)
00376 {
00377         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00378 
00379         uint8_t temp;
00380 
00381         PinCfg.Funcnum = 0;
00382         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00383         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00384         PinCfg.Portnum = 2;
00385         for (temp = 2; temp <= 6; temp++){
00386                 PinCfg.Pinnum = temp;
00387                 PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00388         }
00389 
00390         PinCfg.Funcnum = 0;
00391         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00392         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00393         PinCfg.Portnum = 1;
00394         PinCfg.Pinnum = 28;
00395         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00396         PinCfg.Pinnum = 29;
00397         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00398         PinCfg.Pinnum = 31;
00399         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00400 
00401 
00402         // Set direction to output
00403         LPC_GPIO2->FIODIR |= LED2_MASK;
00404         LPC_GPIO1->FIODIR |= LED1_MASK;
00405 
00406         /* Turn off all LEDs */
00407         LPC_GPIO2->FIOCLR = LED2_MASK;
00408         LPC_GPIO1->FIOCLR = LED1_MASK;
00409 }
00410 /*********************************************************************/
00415 void LED_Blink( uint32_t pattern )
00416 {
00417         uint32_t j;
00418 
00419         LPC_GPIO2->FIOSET = pattern;
00420         for ( j = 0; j < 0x100000; j++ );
00421         LPC_GPIO2->FIOCLR = pattern;
00422         for ( j = 0; j < 0x100000; j++ );
00423 }
00424 
00425 #if TX_ONLY
00426 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00427 /*********************************************************************/
00432 void EINT0_Init(void)
00433 {
00434         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00435 
00436         /* P2.10 as /EINT0 */
00437         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00438         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00439         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00440         PinCfg.Pinnum = 10;
00441         PinCfg.Portnum = 2;
00442         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00443 
00444         //Initialize EXT registers
00445         LPC_SC->EXTINT = 0x0;
00446         LPC_SC->EXTMODE = 0x0;
00447         LPC_SC->EXTPOLAR = 0x0;
00448 
00449         /* edge sensitive */
00450         LPC_SC->EXTMODE = 0xF;
00451         /* falling-edge sensitive */
00452         LPC_SC->EXTPOLAR = 0x0;
00453         /* External Interrupt Flag cleared*/
00454         LPC_SC->EXTINT = 0xF;
00455 
00456         NVIC_SetPriority(EINT0_IRQn, 4);
00457         NVIC_EnableIRQ(EINT0_IRQn);
00458 }
00459 
00460 #elif defined(IAR_LPC_1768) //if using IAR board, using External Interrupt 3
00461 /*********************************************************************/
00466 void EINT3_Init(void)
00467 {
00468         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00469 
00470         /* P2.13 as /EINT3 */
00471         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00472         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00473         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00474         PinCfg.Pinnum = 13;
00475         PinCfg.Portnum = 2;
00476         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00477 
00478         //Initialize EXT registers
00479         LPC_SC->EXTINT = 0x0;
00480         LPC_SC->EXTMODE = 0x0;
00481         LPC_SC->EXTPOLAR = 0x0;
00482 
00483         /* edge sensitive */
00484         LPC_SC->EXTMODE = 0xF;
00485         /* falling-edge sensitive */
00486         LPC_SC->EXTPOLAR = 0x0;
00487         /* External Interrupt Flag cleared*/
00488         LPC_SC->EXTINT = 0xF;
00489 
00490         NVIC_SetPriority(EINT3_IRQn, 4);
00491         NVIC_EnableIRQ(EINT3_IRQn);
00492 }
00493 #endif
00494 #endif

00496 /*********************************************************************/
00501 void Usr_Init_Emac(void)
00502 {
00503         /* EMAC configuration type */
00504         EMAC_CFG_Type Emac_Config;
00505         /* pin configuration */
00506         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00507         uint32_t i;
00508         /*
00509          * Enable P1 Ethernet Pins:
00510          * P1.0 - ENET_TXD0
00511          * P1.1 - ENET_TXD1
00512          * P1.4 - ENET_TX_EN
00513          * P1.8 - ENET_CRS
00514          * P1.9 - ENET_RXD0
00515          * P1.10 - ENET_RXD1
00516          * P1.14 - ENET_RX_ER
00517          * P1.15 - ENET_REF_CLK
00518          * P1.16 - ENET_MDC
00519          * P1.17 - ENET_MDIO
00520          */
00521         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00522         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00523         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00524         PinCfg.Portnum = 1;
00525 
00526         PinCfg.Pinnum = 0;
00527         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00528         PinCfg.Pinnum = 1;
00529         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00530         PinCfg.Pinnum = 4;
00531         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00532         PinCfg.Pinnum = 8;
00533         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00534         PinCfg.Pinnum = 9;
00535         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00536         PinCfg.Pinnum = 10;
00537         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00538         PinCfg.Pinnum = 14;
00539         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00540         PinCfg.Pinnum = 15;
00541         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00542         PinCfg.Pinnum = 16;
00543         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00544         PinCfg.Pinnum = 17;
00545         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00546 
00547         _DBG_("Init EMAC module");
00548         sprintf(db_,"MAC[1..6] addr: %X-%X-%X-%X-%X-%X \n\r", \
00549                          EMACAddr[0],  EMACAddr[1],  EMACAddr[2], \
00550                           EMACAddr[3],  EMACAddr[4],  EMACAddr[5]);
00551         DB;
00552 
00553         Emac_Config.Mode = EMAC_MODE_AUTO;
00554         Emac_Config.pbEMAC_Addr = EMACAddr;
00555         // Initialize EMAC module with given parameter
00556         while (EMAC_Init(&Emac_Config) == ERROR){
00557                 // Delay for a while then continue initializing EMAC module
00558                 _DBG_("Error during initializing EMAC, restart after a while");
00559                 for (i = 0x100000; i; i--);
00560         }
00561         // Enable all interrupt
00562         EMAC_IntCmd((EMAC_INT_RX_OVERRUN | EMAC_INT_RX_ERR | EMAC_INT_RX_FIN \
00563                         | EMAC_INT_RX_DONE | EMAC_INT_TX_UNDERRUN | EMAC_INT_TX_ERR \
00564                         | EMAC_INT_TX_FIN | EMAC_INT_TX_DONE), ENABLE);
00565         NVIC_SetPriority(ENET_IRQn, 0);
00566         NVIC_EnableIRQ(ENET_IRQn);
00567         _DBG_("Initialize EMAC complete");
00568 }
00569 
00570 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00571 /*********************************************************************/
00576 int c_entry (void)
00577 {
00578         /* Data Packet format */
00579         EMAC_PACKETBUF_Type DataPacket;
00580 
00581         uint8_t *txptr;
00582         uint32_t i = 0;
00583 
00584 #if TX_ONLY
00585         uint32_t j;
00586 #endif
00587 
00588 #if BOUNCE_RX
00589         uint8_t *rxptr;
00590 #endif
00591 
00592 #if ENABLE_HASH
00593         uint8_t dstAddr[] = {0x01, 0x02, 0x03, 0x04, 0x05, 0x06};
00594 #endif
00595         NVIC_SetPriorityGrouping(4);  //sets PRIGROUP to 3:2 (XXX:YY)
00596 
00597         //Init LED
00598         LED_Init();
00599 
00600         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00601          *  115200bps
00602          *  8 data bit
00603          *  No parity
00604          *  1 stop bit
00605          *  No flow control
00606          */
00607         debug_frmwrk_init();
00608 
00609         // Init EMAC
00610         Usr_Init_Emac();
00611 
00612 #if TX_ONLY
00613 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00614         EINT0_Init();
00615 #elif defined(IAR_LPC_1768)
00616         EINT3_Init();
00617 #endif
00618         txptr = (uint8_t *)gTxBuf;
00619         /* pre-format the transmit packets */
00620         PacketGen(txptr);
00621 #endif
00622 
00623 #if ENABLE_HASH
00624   EMAC_SetHashFilter(dstAddr, ENABLE);
00625 #endif
00626 
00627 
00628 #if BOUNCE_RX
00629   /* copy just received data from RX buffer to TX buffer and send out */
00630   txptr = (uint8_t *)gTxBuf;
00631   rxptr = (uint8_t *)gRxBuf;
00632 #endif
00633 
00634 #if ENABLE_WOL
00635 
00636   _DBG_("Enter Sleep mode now...");
00637   /*
00638    * On default state, All Multicast frames, All Broadcast frames and Frame that matched
00639    * with station address (unicast) are accepted.
00640    * To make WoL is possible, enable Rx Magic Packet and RxFilter Enable WOL
00641    */
00642   EMAC_SetFilterMode((EMAC_RFC_PFILT_WOL_EN | EMAC_RFC_MAGP_WOL_EN), ENABLE);
00643 
00644         for (i = 0; i < 5; i++){
00645                 LED_Blink(PD_LED_PIN);  /* Indicating system is in power down now. */
00646         }
00647 
00648         // Disable irq interrupt
00649         __disable_irq();
00650 
00651         /* Currently, support Sleep mode */
00652     /* enter sleep mode */
00653     LPC_SC->PCON = 0x0;
00654 
00655     /* Sleep Mode*/
00656     __WFI();
00657 
00658     // CPU will be suspend here...
00659 
00660         /* From power down to WOL, the PLL needs to be reconfigured,
00661         otherwise, the CCLK will be generated from 4Mhz IRC instead
00662         of main OSC 12Mhz */
00663         /* Initialize system clock */
00664         SystemInit();
00665 
00666         /*
00667          * Initialize debug via UART
00668          */
00669         debug_frmwrk_init();
00670         /*
00671          * Init LED
00672          */
00673         LED_Init();
00674         _DBG_("Wake up from sleep mode");
00675 
00676         /* Calling EMACInit() is overkill which also initializes the PHY, the
00677         main reason to do that is to make sure the descriptors and descriptor
00678         status for both TX and RX are clean and ready to use. It won't go wrong. */
00679         Usr_Init_Emac();
00680         // Re-Enable irq interrupt
00681         __enable_irq();
00682 
00683 #endif                                                                          /* endif ENABLE_WOL */
00684 
00685 #if BOUNCE_RX
00686 while( 1 )
00687 {
00688         LED_Blink(BLINK_LED_PIN);
00689         if ( PacketReceived == TRUE )
00690         {
00691           PacketReceived = FALSE;
00692                 /* Reverse Source and Destination, then copy the body */
00693                 memcpy( (uint8_t *)txptr, (uint8_t *)(rxptr+6), 6);
00694                 memcpy( (uint8_t *)(txptr+6), (uint8_t *)rxptr, 6);
00695                 memcpy( (uint8_t *)(txptr+12), (uint8_t *)(rxptr+12), (ReceiveLength - 12));
00696                 _DBG_("Send packet");
00697                 DataPacket.pbDataBuf = (uint32_t *)txptr;
00698                 DataPacket.ulDataLen = ReceiveLength;
00699                 EMAC_WritePacketBuffer(&DataPacket);
00700                 EMAC_UpdateTxProduceIndex();
00701         }
00702 }
00703 #endif  /* endif BOUNCE_RX */
00704 
00705 #if TX_ONLY
00706         /* Transmit packets only */
00707         while ( 1 ) {
00708                 while (Pressed == RESET){
00709                         LED_Blink(BLINK_LED_PIN);
00710                 }
00711                 Pressed = RESET;
00712                 txptr = (uint8_t *)gTxBuf;
00713                 _DBG_("Send packet");
00714                 LED_Blink(TX_LED_PIN);
00715                 DataPacket.pbDataBuf = (uint32_t *)txptr;
00716                 // Note that there're 4-byte CRC added
00717                 DataPacket.ulDataLen = TX_PACKET_SIZE + 4;
00718                 EMAC_WritePacketBuffer(&DataPacket);
00719                 EMAC_UpdateTxProduceIndex();
00720                 for ( j = 0; j < 0x200000; j++ );       /* delay */
00721         }
00722 #endif  /* endif TX_ONLY */
00723   return 0;
00724 }
00725 
00726 
00727 
00728 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00729    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00730    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00731    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00732    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00733 int main(void)
00734 {
00735     return c_entry();
00736 }
00737 
00738 
00739 #ifdef  DEBUG
00740 /*******************************************************************************
00741 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00742 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00743 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00744 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00745 * @return               None
00746 *******************************************************************************/
00747 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00748 {
00749         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00750          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00751 
00752         /* Infinite loop */
00753         while(1);
00754 }
00755 #endif

00758 **                            End Of File
